title: Debt Collection Negotiations with Large Language Models: An Evaluation System and Optimizing Decision Making with Multi-Agent
author: Xiaofeng Wang (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Zhixin Zhang (Ant Group), Jinguang Zheng (Ant Group), Yiming Ai (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Rui Wang (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores the use of large language models (LLMs) in optimizing decision-making, which could be applied to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of audio processing tasks, particularly in the context of automated dialogue systems.
background: Automating debt collection negotiations using advanced AI language models to balance the needs of creditors and debtors through multi-agent interactions.
contribution: This paper introduces a multi-agent framework that enhances negotiation performance in debt collection scenarios, achieving better decision-making outcomes for both creditors and debtors.
technical_comparison: Previous methods mainly utilized fixed formats and lacked dynamic negotiation capabilities. This work improves by implementing a multi-agent system with planning and judging functionalities to optimize decision-making in real-time.
key_innovation: Utilizes a multi-agent framework that allows for self-planning and self-adjustment during negotiations, improving overall negotiation outcomes.
real_world_impact: The developed framework has the potential to significantly enhance automation in debt recovery, increasing efficiency and reducing losses for financial institutions in real-world applications.
limitations: The simplicity of the current multi-agent framework may not capture all complexities of real-world negotiations and requires further refinement.

new_terms.multi-agent framework: **Multi-agent framework** refers to a system where multiple intelligent agents interact and collaborate to achieve specific goals, improving the decision-making process.
new_terms.large language models (LLMs): **Large language models (LLMs)** are advanced AI algorithms capable of understanding and generating human-like text based on vast amounts of data.

open_sourcing: The synthetic data used in this paper is publicly available.
